item.title: What Disturbing Art Can Teach Us About Our Own Shame and Fear
item.description: I found myself drawn to 18th-century sculptures. When I see them, I see myself — a stutterer.

item.title: This Easy Side Does Double Duty at Dinner
item.description: Parsnips dressed in miso and lemon, then topped with arugula and Parmesan can be a glorious accompaniment — or the whole meal.

item.title: ‘To Catch a Predator’ Ended Almost 20 Years Ago. Its Grim Legacy Lives on.
item.description: The flippant humiliation that once coursed through the reality-TV landscape has found a more dynamic environment online, where our hunger for schadenfreude can run wild.

item.title: The Filmmaker Who Finds the Humanity in History’s ‘Monsters’
item.description: Joshua Oppenheimer’s films show the political value of empathy in our polarized age.

item.title: Can You Use Your Spouse as a Hand Towel?
item.description: A ruling on a home hygiene dispute.

item.title: Sean Penn Let Himself Get Away With Things for 15 Years. Not Anymore.
item.description: The actor and instigator is ready for his renaissance.

item.title: I’m Concerned About Sweatshops. Should It Change What I Buy?
item.description: How to balance a concern for human rights with concern for those who depend on jobs in overseas factories?

item.title: What the Public Memory of Charlie Kirk Revealed
item.description: For those who felt denigrated by his rhetoric, the bipartisan tributes to him as a champion of free speech augured something dangerous: the mainstreaming of formerly extremist views.

item.title: Want to Know What Men Are Thinking? Go Get a Haircut.
item.description: The version of masculinity you might see getting your hair cut is more complex than the caricature presented in the manosphere.

item.title: Five Takeaways About the Culture of Lawlessness in the U.S. Special Forces
item.description: Until now, many of the troubling events that took place during the war in Afghanistan have been shrouded in secrecy.

item.title: The L.A. Dodgers Risk Alienating Their Fans or Angering Trump
item.description: For decades, the Dodgers have been the pride of L.A.’s Latino community. Trump’s immigration raids are testing that.

item.title: Is It OK to Talk to My Daughter About Her Weight?
item.description: She may be headed for a serious problem. How can we raise this with her without pushing her away?

item.title: Why Jane Goodall Still Has Hope for Us Humans
item.description: “Traveling the world I’d see so many projects of restoration, people tackling what seemed impossible and not giving up.”

item.title: Nine Bodies Turned Up at a Green Beret Outpost. What Really Happened?
item.description: In 2012, after a team member was nearly killed, a Special Forces unit went on a rampage that might have been one of the worst war crimes in recent U.S. history.
